definition: common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs

sentences.english: And Republican leaders say that they agree we must avoid default.
sentences.chinese: 共和黨領導人說，他們同意我們必須避免債務欠付。

sentences.english: But then again, I have had a hard time understanding the G. O. P. for a while now.
sentences.chinese: 不過，老實說，我早已不明白共和黨究竟在幹什麼。

sentences.english: A tentative agreement struck on Thursday evaporated after a revolt by House Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 週四，由於共和黨變卦，一份臨時協議被撤銷。

sentences.english: It left examples of his complimenting Republicans on the cutting-room floor.
sentences.chinese: 它留下了他的恭維切割室地板共和黨人例子。

sentences.english: But even doing all that wasn't enough to satisfy the bastard Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 但是就這些也不能讓共和黨的雜種們滿意。

sentences.english: The verdict throws more uncertainty into the Republican rocky re-election bid.
sentences.chinese: 這個裁定給共和黨的連任選舉增加了更多的不確定性。

sentences.english: McConnell said Republicans would fight the health-care legislation as hard as they could.
sentences.chinese: 麥康奈爾說，共和黨人將竭盡全力反對健保法案。

sentences.english: statutory debt limit as early as March 31, and newlyemboldened Republican lawmakers intend to use the need to raise it as leveragefor spending cuts.
sentences.chinese: 底氣十足的共和黨議員打算靠提高它來削減開支。

sentences.english: This group hews more closely to Democrats than Republicans.
sentences.chinese: 相比起共和黨，這一羣人更傾向民主黨。

sentences.english: But there's no question that Republicans were very successful at demonizing the plan.
sentences.chinese: 但是共和黨人已毫無疑問地成功妖魔化健改。

sentences.english: Republicans have the right to filibuster under centuries-old rules that this page has long defended.
sentences.chinese: 長久以來的慣例是，共和黨人有阻撓議案通過的權利。

sentences.english: Republican leaders in Congress are trying to repeal the law outright.
sentences.chinese: 議會中的共和黨領導試圖徹底廢除該法案。

sentences.english: Yet he, like Hoover, is the candidate of the incumbent party.
sentences.chinese: 但是，和胡佛一樣，他畢竟是共和黨的成員。

sentences.english: So what’s really motivating the G.O.P. attack on the Fed?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，共和黨攻擊美聯儲的真正動機是什麼？

sentences.english: The problem with Establishment Republicans is they abhor the unseemliness of a political brawl.
sentences.chinese: 共和黨的人問題是他們厭惡不成體統的政治上的爭鬥。

sentences.english: They nominated explorer John Fremont as their candidate for the national election. Fremont had been the Republican presidential candidate eight years earlier.
sentences.chinese: 弗裏蒙特早在八年前就曾經是共和黨的總統候選人。

definition: to take part in an election/to run for office
Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
lower house of bicameral assembly/House of Representatives (USA)/Chamber of Deputies
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
